home.title: your one way stop to get all relevant data for swiss public transport
home.intro: This project was created by two students from the FHNW during during the project track. Our goal is to create a proxy for the OJP-Service provided by our customer SKI+ and provide responses in a more developer friendly format. Explore our API and start building with Swiss transport data today!

featureCardDoc.title: documentation
featureCardDoc.text: Get started with our comprehensive API documentation and integrate Swiss public transport data into your application today.

featureCardLIR.title: location information
featureCardLIR.text: Quickly retrieve the unique ID for any train station in Switzerland. Use our Location Information Request endpoint to get precise station data, essential for making accurate transportation queries.

featureCardStationBoard.title: station board
featureCardStationBoard.text: Discover how to create a dynamic station board displaying departing trains for any location. Explore our demo application and see the Station Board endpoint in action.

steps.LIR: First you need to retrieve an id for your station that you want to get further information on. For this enter a name and the API returns a list of potential matches ordered by probability. This can also be used for a dropdown list or autocompletion as seen in our demo application.
steps.StationBoard: Next you can enter the precise location Name or the StationRef identifier from the previous step to get a list of all departing trains or busses from this location.

description.station: Specifies the location name to search for
description.id: The stationRef for the entered location name
description.datetime: Specific date for the station board
description.stationName: Specifies the location name to search for

docsIntroduction.header:
Welcome to the OJP-Explorer documentation!
This guide will help you get started with accessing and using the API to retrieve data about Swiss public transport.

docsGettingStarted.header:
Welcome to the OJP-Explorer documentation!
This guide will help you get started with accessing and using the API to retrieve data about Swiss public transport.

step1.title: Get your Key
step1.description:
To authenticate your requests, you need an API key. You can obtain an API key by signing up on the official OJP-Developer portal.
 You can find the developer portal under the following link: {link}

This API key needs to be included in the Authorization header of your HTTP requests.

For all demos on the OJP-Explorer, you can set your API key using the option at the top-right of the page. The option is indicated like the following button.

step2.title: Retrieve StationRef identifier
step2.description: First you need to retrieve an id for your station that you want to get further information on. For this enter a name and the API returns a list of potential matches ordered by probability.

step3.title: Fetch the StationBoard
step3.description: Next you can enter the precise location Name or the StationRef identifier from the previous step to get a list of all departing trains or busses from this location. This information you could use in your next implementation of you local station board.

docsStationBoard.ojpResponse: The following shows the response which the OJP-Service sends when querying the OJPStopEventRequest endpoint.
docsStationBoard.ojpProxyResponse: The response shown above from the OJP-Service gets translated into JSON in our OJP-Proxy backend the result looks like this.

docsLocationInformation.ojpResponse: The following shows the response which the OJP-Service sends when querying the OJPLocationInformationRequest endpoint.
docsLocationInformation.ojpProxyResponse: The response shown above from the OJP-Service gets translated into JSON in our OJP-Proxy backend the result looks like this.

ui.apiTokenDescription: For the API to work you need to create an API Key on the OJP Developer Portal
